intro: Rhynchosia elisae, commonly known as the Elisae burr legume, is a flowering plant belonging to the Fabaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its distinctive, hairy, and often spiny pods. The plant typically grows as an erect or sprawling shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its small, white or pale yellow flowers are clustered in racemes, and the leaves are trifoliate, with three oval-shaped leaflets. Rhynchosia elisae is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in such conditions.
